posts.post_content:
Started playing last year, pulled Bolas last week at prerelease as my first planeswalker. Never managed to get him out as I either had the mana but not him or him and not the mana. Put him into my G/B ramp deck and added a decent amount of fixing to pay his blue and red cost. Pretty excited to try him out, he seems really fun to play.  
  
Edit: I've managed to get him out now on a semi-regular basis. He's absolutely ridiculous once he hits the field, even if I never pull off his -9. Plus, starting at 5 loyalty keeps him from being easily burnt on arrival. Still, I feel like a huge jerk whenever I manage to get him out because he just trounces people.  
  
  
@PinkMage, you say this card sucks in every way including casual, and yet you bring up Mind Sculptor? I would much rather stare down Bolas than having to deal with Mind Sculptor's carnival of frustration. And why do you berate this one card so terribly? It's like Nicol Bolas killed your parents or something.  
  
Plus, as others have said, part... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Now this is the story all about how   
My life got {T}, turned upside down   
And I'd like to take a minute just sit right there   
I'll tell you how I became the King of a place called al-air  
  
In west Dominaria born and raised   
In the Multiverse where I spent most of my days   
Chilling out, maxing, relaxing all cool   
And all shooting some good guys outside of the school   
When a couple of guys, they were up to some good   
Started making trouble in my neighbourhood   
I got in one little fight and Madara got scared   
And said "You're moving with your spark into al-air"   
  
I whistled for a portal and when it came near the   
Sarkhan Vol said "fresh" and saw a thing like a mirror  
If anything I could say that this thing was rare   
But I thought nah, forget it, yo homes to al-air!   
  
I pulled up to a plane about seven or eight   
And I yelled to Sarkhan "Yo, Vols smell you later!"   
Looked at my kingdom I was finally there   
To sit on my throne as the prince of Alar(a)

And I'd like to take a minute just sit right there

In the Multiverse where I spent most of my days
Chilling out, maxing, relaxing all cool
And all shooting some good guys outside of the school
When a couple of guys, they were up to some good
Started making trouble in my neighbourhood
I got in one little fight and Madara got scared
And said "You're moving with your spark into al-air"

I whistled for a portal and when it came near the
Sarkhan Vol said "fresh" and saw a thing like a mirror
If anything I could say that this thing was rare
But I thought nah, forget it, yo homes to al-air!

I pulled up to a plane about seven or eight
And I yelled to Sarkhan "Yo, Vols smell you later!"
Looked at my kingdom I was finally there
To sit on my throne as the prince of Alar(a)

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (7/14/2012 11:15:38 AM)

posts.post_content:
Today Gavin Verhey wrote this article about how to win in Standard by using a deck that could take out the other archetypes. Towards the end of it, he wrote: "If only there was an expensive, powerful Planeswalker who fits right into a blue-black-red control deck, dealt with any permanent type, and had an ultimate that should usually win you the game on its own. It would be great if a card like that was in Standard. It would also be cool if that character was some kind of legendary, iconic creature from Magic's storyline who previously had a non-Planeswalker card version of himself..."  
  
And I thought of course, Bolas.  
Expensive, check.  
Powerful, triple check.  
Planeswalker, check.  
Fits into U/B/R control deck, check.  
Dealt with any permanent type, (combo of +3 or -2) check.  
Game-winning ultimate, uh 7 damage? Check.  
Iconic non-planeswalker. [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas). Check.  
  
And then he says that it's [Karn Liberated](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn Liberated).  
  
It seems Gavin was major trolling me...

posts.post_content:
[Karn Liberated](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn Liberated) didn't *quite* poop on this guy, but he pretty much did. He can exile any permanent, make players 'discard' to exile, and his ultimate also makes you win. All that, and he costs less, and is completely colourless.  
  
He's definitely not worse than karn though. His abilities are actually quite a bit more powerful. Karn is just more likely to land and do something.
posts.html:

He's definitely not worse than karn though. His abilities are actually quite a bit more powerful. Karn is just more likely to land and do something.

posts.post_content:
I've been trying to build a deck around this guy for awhile now. Its not perfect, but one thing is certain, if you drop this guy and your opponent doesn't have:  
  
a) A counter or really powerful burn  
b) A [Dreadbore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreadbore)  
or  
c) A [Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage)  
  
Then your opponent weeps. Oh such bitter tears does he weep. I've played him several times thanks to [Gilded Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded Lotus) and no one I've faced has ever managed to kill him through brute force.
posts.html:
